Archives and Special Collections, New York University Abu Dhabi Library
Travel in the Middle East Album
Fischer, Paul
AD.MC.042
130 Photographic Prints The album measures album 26 x 26 cm, each photograph around 7.7 x 10.5cm. Photographs all in good condition, a few are missing. The album has damage to the spine but not to the binding.
August 1966 042
Biographical / Historical
Text from the album seller: "The name of the person was Paul Fischer. He was a soldier in World War I. From 1916-1919 as Eisenbahn-Pionier. In this time he worked at the railroad of the Bagdad-railroad. After World War I he was a prisoner of war (Kriegsgefangener) in Türkei and had finished the railroad for the firm Holzmann, Frankfurt/Main. After this time and back in Germany he married his wife in 1.10.1927. Her name war Anna, borned as Liebing (Mädchenname, the name before they married). He lived in Penig (saxonia in Germany). Later he worked at the "Adolf Oeser Maschinen-Fabrik", in Leipzig, until 1940. The years 1941-1945 he worked in the "Getriebewerk" in Penig. He died in East Germany."
Arrangement
Collection was processed in order that it was recieved
Conditions Governing Access
No restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
NYU Abu Dhabi holds all copyright and related rights pertaining to this collection. Please contact Akkasah at akkasah@nyu.edu for information regarding information and use.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Album: Travels in the Middle East; AD_MC_042; box number; folder number or item identifier; Akkasah Center for Photography, New York University.
